alert.note: Alert for Southeast Suffolk; Southern Nassau; Southwest Suffolk (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Rip Current Statement issued September 16 at 4:18AM EDT until September 16 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON... ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING... ...HIGH RIP CURRENT RISK REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THIS EVENING... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...For the Coastal Flood Statement, a reasonable worst case of up to 1 ft of inundation above ground level expected in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline. For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 10 to 16 feet this morning in the surf zone, then gradually subsiding through the weekend. For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Southwest Suffolk, Southeast Suffolk and Southern Nassau Counties. * WHEN...For the Coastal Flood Statement, through this afternoon. For the High Surf Advisory, until 8 PM EDT this evening. For the High Rip Current Risk, through this evening. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding is expected in the more vulnerable locations near the waterfront and shoreline. Some roads and low lying properties including parking lots, parks, lawns, and homes and businesses with basements near the waterfront will experience minor flooding. * SWIMMING IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions Tonight through Saturday. Life-threatening rip currents are likely for all people entering the surf zone. Anyone visiting the beaches should stay out of the surf. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water. * BEACH EROSION AND FLOODING IMPACTS...Large breaking waves will result in widespread areas of dune erosion and scattered overwashes through today`s high tides. This may result in scattered areas of minor flooding of roadways and vulnerable structures behind protective dunes. * FORECAST CHALLENGES...There is still uncertainty in the timing of peak surge relative to the times of high tide today, the magnitude of wave setup effects over several tidal cycles, and the fact that Lee is moving to the northeast of the region. For these reasons, this coastal flood forecast represents a reasonable worst case forecast.
info.instruction: Do not drive through flooded roadways. Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions. If you enter the surf zone, always have a flotation device with you and swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float, and do not swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and yell or wave for help.

area.areaDesc: Southeast Suffolk; Southern Nassau; Southwest Suffolk
